definition: to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: Next, must display sincerely, avoids speaking insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要表現出真誠，避免言不由衷。

sentences.english: There has been a great deal of politician's cant .
sentences.chinese: 說了一大堆政客慣用的言不由衷的話。

sentences.english: He and I are ambiguous between the insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 我和他之間的曖昧都是言不由衷。

sentences.english: He was mouthing the usual platitudes about the need for more compassion .
sentences.chinese: 他言不由衷地說些需要更加同情之類的陳腔濫調。

sentences.english: Gradually a sense of the insincerity in her words began to bother her.
sentences.chinese: 逐漸地她的文字中的一絲言不由衷開始令她困擾。

sentences.english: False, that is exaggerated, insincere, courteously but without sincerity, cover-up.
sentences.chinese: 假，就是誇大其詞，言不由衷，虛與委蛇，文過飾非。

sentences.english: Time Aituoao will also have will speak insincerely , the people inconvenience to get to the root.
sentences.chinese: 埃託奧也會有言不由衷時候，人們不便去刨根問底。

sentences.english: Sometimes what people say hides their real meaning.
sentences.chinese: 有時候人們說的話言不由衷。

sentences.english: Even if Rafa is doing his inarticulate heckling from the cheap seats.
sentences.chinese: 儘管拉法排名靠後還言不由衷地進行着質問。

sentences.english: Under some circumstances, we always habitually talk insincerely .
sentences.chinese: 在一些情況下，我們總是習慣性地言不由衷。

sentences.english: But the administration cannot be disingenuous or obtuse.
sentences.chinese: 但是，政府不能言不由衷或者對政策反應遲鈍。

definition: false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
to say one thing but mean another/to dissimulate
to speak harshly but without any bad intent (idiom)
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
